At Fri, 21 Nov 2008 17:43:35 +0000,
Mike <mike@...> wrote:
> I si=
mply don't agree that they need to be separate resources because 
> they ar=
en't separate resources. If updating one updates the other; they 
> are sep=
arate representations of the *same* resource.

By this reasoning, if we hav=
e two resources, <Earth> and <San
Francisco>, the fact that, when we DELETE=
 <Earth>, <San Francisco> is
also DELETEd, means that <Earth> is equivalent=
 to <San Francisco>.

> I'm not trying to convert you, I'm merely suggestin=
g that my approach 
> is not just feasible and practically solvable; it is =
in a way which is 
> completely compatible with your method of splitting re=
presentations into 
> separate URIs.
>

e can both have our own ways of doing this - you can just ignore the

ept attribute and continue putting the content type in the URI. It

't change anything for you.

different resources the
same URI.
 
> And the whole 'how do users and cache=
s know which URIs are tied

e either.
